intro: Rolandra reptans, commonly known as the creeping rolandra, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, prostrate stems that root at the nodes, allowing it to spread along the ground. Its small, daisy-like flowers are typically yellow or white, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Rolandra reptans is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and arid environments.
